radiographic_examinations.findings: Moderate systolic dysfunction and a left ventricular (LV) ejection fraction of 40% with midanterior wall and apical wall hypokinesis and inferior wall akinesis.
Ejection fraction of 30% with multiple wall motion abnormalities, most notable inferiorly.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressive decline in ejection fraction from 30% to 15%-20%.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Negative for pulmonary emboli or any arterial filling defects.

Mildly dilated LV, severe biventricular systolic dysfunction (LV ejection fraction, 20%; RV ejection fraction, 19%), diffuse myocardial edema with patchy subendocardial perfusion defects, and diffuse late gadolinium enhancement consistent with myocarditis, microvascular obstruction, or vasculitis.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Demonstrated worsening systolic dysfunction over time.
